subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit Patch: Reducing duplication in all TestCase s everywhere
msgSnippet: There are several ways to run setUp once per suite. 1) use a TestDecorator or the TestSetup class; the run method does the session setup prior to invoking
messageBody:
There are several ways to run setUp once per suite.

1) use a TestDecorator or the TestSetup class; the run method does the
session setup prior to invoking tests within the wrapped suite

2) extend your own TestSuite to do something similar. What I've done to
support launching GUI apps once per suite is put the launch/terminate in
explicitly similar to setUp/tearDown, and added hooks to enable/disable
these functions. This way, if each test is run on its own or invoked
from the JUnit runner, it works properly. If run as a suite, I extended
a TestSuite to enable launch on the first test and terminate on the last.

T.
